subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Book for sale on how to modify the 12-469, why?
author: Zack Widup
full_text:
Good question. I'm so used to doing thorough searches on Internet for data 
before I buy it that I almost never have to buy any sort of data sheets or 
instruction books anymore. I did have to buy a manual on how to CLA 
(clean, lubricate and adjust) a Rapax large-format camera shutter because 
the full info wasn't available on-line.

But a lot of people aren't used to such searches and probably would just 
pay out the money.  And look at the spammers.  If someone weren't falling 
for their garbage they would all just dry up and blow away. There must be 
at least a few dumb people out there.

Zack


On Fri, 21 Nov 2008, M.A. Coletta (Mike) wrote:

> It was brought to my attention that a guy named Dave Oester is selling
> an ebook on how to modify the Radio Shack 12-469, something he calls
> the 'Digcom'. (Isn't it just the Radio Shack Hack?)
> Has anyone purchased this book? Has anyone had dealings with this Dave
> Oester?  I guess he produces other types of ebooks too.
>
> There is so much FREE information out there on how to modify the 12-
> 469, I wonder if his book is actually selling...
>
> Thanks,
> - Mike C. (UFO Geek)
>
>
